question.text:
refer to the following notice.

The city’s Waste Management Division has been cleaning Brentridge’s streets twice a month. However, in response to the rapid accumulation of trash in several districts, we have decided to increase the frequency of this service to once a week starting May 1 (1) ___we hope to 103« improve the appearance of public areas while removing substances that could contaminate the environment.
There are a few things that you need to be aware of. First, each neighborhood has been assigned a day of the week for its streets to be cleaned. (2) ___Additionally, residents must make sure to keep their curbs (3)------- at these times. This is vital as our cleaning vehicles will be unable to reach them otherwise. We would truly appreciate your (4) ___with these changes.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

choices: (B)Please visit our Web site to see when this will occur in your area.
(C)The mayor will address citizens’ concerns at the next town hall meeting.
(D)The city plans to implement a new recycling program to reduce waste.
A) Refrain from disposing of toxic materials outside of these designated areas.

answer.text: (B)Please visit our Web site to see when this will occur in your area.
answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of previous sentence " First, each neighborhood has been assigned a day of the week for its streets to be cleaned."
Based on the meaning of words.
By phrase "appreciate your cooperation"

question.text:
refer to the following article

Balter Food Reaches Agreement with Lexi’s
July 21—National grocery chain Balter Food (1) ------ organic produce company Lexi’s.
Negotiations began in October of last year, and the transaction came to a close last Monday.
Lexi’s was founded nearly six decades ago but struggled to recover from losses for quite a while. Its attempt to enter the California market with the opening of new locations proved (2) ___.This caus0d Lexi’s to fall behind its competition.
Balter Food representatives say that 15 of the 29 Lexi’s stores are now in the process of being renamed “Balter.” (3)-----. The performance of these stores will be monitored closely to 145.determine whether they should undergo additional modifications. According to consultants, this is the best strategy as loyal Lexi’s customers may need to (4) ----- during the transition.

answer.explanation: Use perfect present tense.
Based on the meaning of words.

choices: (A) Some suggest that the renovations |ỊH were an excessive expenditure.
(B)The new brand will represent Baiter’s most recent innovation.
(C)All other branch names will be changed gradually over the course of a year.
(D)The market for grocery stores has become flooded in recent years.

answer.text: (C)All other branch names will be changed gradually over the course of a year.
answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of previous sentence "Balter Food representatives say that 15 of the 29 Lexi’s stores are now in the process of being renamed “Balter.”"
Based on the meaning of words.

question.text:
refer to the following advertisement.
Do you find (1)----- your home more trouble than it’s worth? If so, call Wimberley’s—the most trusted housekeeping service in Kent. Since opening five years ago, we have consistently received top ratings from our customers.

(2) ___Our crew takes care of window and floor washing, vacuuming, and tile polishing. Weuse state-of-the-art equipment to get rid of the odors, dirt, and stains you’ve been struggling with. Furthermore, if you need to remove large (3) ------ items such as furniture or appliances, the Wimberley’s staff can do this for a small additional fee.

We (4) ----- your home at whatever time is most convenient for you! So, if you’re interested, please call US at 555-9190.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words. "clean your house"

choices: (A) You may join the crew by sending in your application.
(B)We also sell a wide range of cleaning products.
(C)Wimberley’s does all the tiresome jobs that you don’t have the time for.
(D)Our service schedule will be posted online once we resume operations.

answer.text: (C)Wimberley’s does all the tiresome jobs that you don’t have the time for.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence "Our crew takes care of window and floor washing, vacuuming, and tile polishing."
Based on the meaning of words.
Use structure with model verb to describe ability.

question.text:
refer to the following e-mail.
To: Talia Moroz (talia.moroz@homemail.com)
From: Miles Kaufmann (m.kaufmann@coldmaker.com)
Date: July 31
Subject: Your request

Dear Ms. Moroz,

I am writing in reply to your inquiry about the Coldmaker refrigerator you purchased recently. In your e-mail, you stated that the compartment does not close properly. (1)------- issue was brought up by other customers in the past. Our technicians have since discovered what the problem is. (2)------.

As indicated in the manual, to (3) ------- the door, you must push it forward until a clicking sound is heard. If you simply close the compartment without holding the tab, the door will not remain closed.

Could you please try this method first? If you continue to have a problem, please contact a service center (4)------ on our Web site.

Thank you for writing, and I hope I have been of service to you.


Sincerely,

Miles Kaufmann
Warranty service agent

answer.explanation: Used to refer to an event that happened in the previous sentence => This issue = the compartment does not close properly => Choose "This"

choices: (A) We are glad that you have found a solution to the problem.
(B)It appears that users are not following product manual guidelines.
(C)A serviceman will visit your home in a day or two.
(D)The appliance you purchased is no longer for sale due to this defect.

answer.text: (B)It appears that users are not following product manual guidelines.
answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of previous sentence "Our technicians have since discovered what the problem is."
Based on the meaning of words. "secure the door"
Use past simple

question.text:
refer to the following e-mail

To: Henry Chan (h.chan@followmail.com)
From: Gleeson Consulting (hr@gleeson.com)
Date: March 14
Subject: Re: Application for project manager position

Dear Mr. Chan,

We received your application for project manager at Gleeson Consulting. The company had a large number of applicants, so (1)------- for the position was rather strong. I therefore regret to inform you that you have not been shortlisted for this post. (2) ___, we have closely examined your qualifications and consider you eligible for the project assistant position. (3)----

Interviews for this vacancy will take place on March 20 from 10 A.M. to 3 P.M. Please get in touch with me to let me know if you are interested in the job and can come in between these times. If you are not (4) ___ perhaps we can arrange a date that is more convenient for you.


Yours truly,

Jacqueline Hart
Human resources manager
Gleeson Consulting

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words.
a large number of applicants -> competition
Based on the the meaning of the previous sentence => need to fill a conjunction to show a contrast between the two events.

choices: (A)Some of the documents we requested were missing from your application.
(B)We do not have vacancies at this time, but may consider your application in the future.
(C)Your offer to find a suitable applicant was accepted.
(D)We hope you will consider being interviewed for this opening.

answer.text: (D)We hope you will consider being interviewed for this opening.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence.
Based on the meaning of words.

question.text:
refer to the following announcement.

CALL FOR PAPERS



The Department of Sociology at the University of Northern Wisconsin (1)------- an academic conference on social transformation In the Midwestern United States from June 7 to 9. (2)------. Interested professors and lecturers are asked to submit their abstracts before May 1.

You will be sent a notification from the department if your (3)------ is selected. Once you receive this notice, you will be required to submit the full paper for review and approval.

Submissions are welcome from all universities, and we look forward to seeing a range of topics. (4)------ the conference’s focus on the Midwest, we welcome work from other regions as long as it relates to the needs of the target area.

answer.explanation: Use the continuous prevent tense, based on "from June 7 to 9"

choices: (B) In this regard, we are now accepting proposals related to this topic.
(C)We are pleased to have you on the committee and will provide needed support.
(D)In addition, it featured speakers from regional education establishments
A) A number of applicants were awarded grants for this project.

answer.text: (B) In this regard, we are now accepting proposals related to this topic.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence.
Baased on the meaning of words.
Based on structure "Despite + Noun/ noun phrase, clause "

question.text: March 12 - Starting from next month, street parking in the city center will be free. City council members chose ---1--- the use of parking meters downtown by a unanimous vote. Rising wages are needed for city workers to check parking meters and issue tickets, so the practice is no longer ---2---. Officials hope the change will also ---3--- development of the downtown area by encouraging more visitors, many of whom are shoppers from out of town. The change will go into effect on April 1, though the meters won’t be removed immediately. ---4---.

answer.explanation: Based on structure "choose + to - verb"
Before is the verb tobe, so an adjective is needed. => Choose D is correct
Based on the meaning of words. "foster development"

choices: (A) Signs will be posted to notify motorists.
(B) Traffic updates can be requested by text.
(C) The parking fee is considered reasonable.
(D) Please pay your parking fines promptly.

answer.text: (A) Signs will be posted to notify motorists.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence "The change will go into effect on April 1, though the meters won’t be removed immediately."

question.text:
To: Crucero Staff (stafflist@crucero.net)
From: Gabrielle Jensen (jensong@crucero.net)
Date: November 16
Subject: Overtime hours

The members of the finance team have ---1--- examined the budgets for our branch and, through their meticulous work, determined that there is a significant shortfall. ---2--- this discovery, we must reduce operating expenses by minimizing overtime hours. Please try to get all of your work ---3--- within the usual business hours. In cases where overtime work cannot be avoided, it should be approved in advance by a department head. ---4---. Thank you for your cooperation.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Jensen

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.
Both A and B mean "Because" but behind the blank is a noun phrase, so we choose B.
get/have + sth + PII

choices: (A) Please send in your detailed budgets as soon as possible.
(B) Most employees prefer working on Saturdays over working on Sundays.
(C) This applies to both sales and administration employees.
(D) The additional payment has been deposited in your account.

answer.text: (C) This applies to both sales and administration employees.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence "In cases where overtime work cannot be avoided, it should be approved in advance by a department head."

question.text:
Dawsonville in Motion, a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healthy lifestyles, ---1--- a Well-Being Festival for Saturday, August 18. The group wants to raise ---2--- of the methods for preventing heart disease and other conditions. The goal of many of the festival activities will be to show participants that they don’t have to adhere strictly to a diet. ---3---. For example, a piece of fruit can replace a candy bar as an afternoon snack. ---4---, diners can swap French fries for a salad.
Want more helpful tips? Come to the festival! It will be held at the Dawsonville Community Center, and admission is free to everyone.

answer.explanation: This sentence lacks a verb with the subject being Dawsonville in Motion (singular noun), so choose C.
Based on structure:  "raise awarenes of something"

choices: (A) They can make small changes to improve their health.
(B) Organizers hope that the turnout is better than last year.
(C) The diet can be downloaded from the group’s Web site.
(D) Rates of medical problems are on the rise in Dawsonville.

answer.text: (A) They can make small changes to improve their health.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence "For example, a piece of fruit can replace a candy bar as an afternoon snack."

Building on the previous sentence mentioning small changes and giving the example “For example, a piece of fruit can replace a candy bar as an afternoon snack.” so the place to be filled in is a word that shows consistency with the action in the previous 2 sentences.

question.text:
CHARACK TOWERS: NOTICE



---1--- of Charack Towers should be aware that the power will be turned off to most of the complex on Thursday, September 18 at 9 A.M. to install new wiring. ---2---. The power should be restored by noon, but if the work takes longer than expected, it might affect ---3--- goods in your refrigerator. We will notify you if the work exceeds the estimated schedule so that you may check that your food is still edible. Please note that this planned outage will affect all parts of Charack lowers the ---4--- South Tower, which was upgraded last quarter. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

answer.explanation: Behind the space to be filled in is "of Charack Towers", so a noun is needed, type A, C. The verb in the sentence is "should be aware" so this sentence has an active meaning, type B (occupation). ).

choices: (A) We must do so to comply with safety regulations.
(B) If you would like to sign up, visit the property office.
(C) The loss of power was caused by a severe storm.
(D) Please wear protective gear while you are working

answer.text: (A) We must do so to comply with safety regulations.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence that mentioned "installing new wiring", choosing A is the most reasonable.
Based on the meaning of words.
Based on the "tower that was upgraded last quarter" behind, choosing C is the most reasonable. => Choose C
